title: Suddenly, yesterday, my email stopped allowing me to send emails.
creator: mpaxton
content:
My email set-up is a mess. In December, when I had a problem, my provider told me to open a new account, which I did. Both my old and new accounts received emails for a few days, and then only the new account was receiving emails. Now I find that my drafts and sent messages are saved to the old account, and suddenly yesterday I was unable to send emails, from either account.

I keep getting this error message: "Sending of the message failed. Peer reports incompatible or unsupported protocol version.: The configuration related to mail.activ8.net.au must be corrected"

I have no idea what this means or how to correct it.

title: All folders gone for one of the hotmail-accounts
creator: bankzilla
content:
I use Thunderbird 140.7.1esr (64-bits). I have a lot of accounts in my own domain, but also a few gmail-accounts and 2 hotmail-accounts. Since a few days (don't know exactly when this started), all folders of one of the 2 hotmail-accounts were lost in Thunderbird. So, there is no Inbox, Outbox, Deleted, etc. Also my own made folders are gone. All folders are present in the original outlook.live.com website (home of the hotmail-accounts). Also, on my smartphone all folders are still present. And last but not least: I've deleted the hotmail-account itself on my computer and created it again. All settings are the same as in the other hotmail-account. And guess what? First I could create the Inbox again, but while looking at the list of all my accounts I saw the inbox disappearing and I was left with the account without any folder.

Now I'm confused: the folders are present in de original mailbox (outlook) and in my phone (where I use Thunderbird for Android), but not in the Thunderbird-mailbox on my computer. Meanwhile the other similar hotmail-account is working just fine. And last of all: this is a configuration that has been working fine for years now.

What is happening here? Is there anyone with a great idea, or same experience?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:140.7.1esr (64-bits);os:Windows 11

title: Thunderbird IMAP Inbox empty even after account removal/re-addition
creator: luca.giorgetti6
content:
Hello,

I am experiencing a critical issue where all received emails for one specific IMAP account have disappeared from Thunderbird. They are NOT visible in the Unified Inbox, nor in the account's specific Inbox folder.

- The Inbox folder is completely empty (or only shows a single test email I just sent to myself).

- The emails are NOT visible on Webmail. All of them are stored in Gmail, which I'm willing to move away from. I already have toggled the "keep a copy of the message" in the mail settings in Gmail but nothing chanced.

- When I try to "Subscribe" to folders, the checkbox for "INBOX" is missing or grayed out.

- Thunderbird shows a notification for a new mail, the mail stays here for a few minutes, then it disappears.

- The test emails I sent a couple of hours ago already disappeared.

- This happens with only one specific email. All the others work fine.

What I have already tried:

- Removed and re-added the account entirely (multiple times). 

- Repaired the folder via Folder Properties > Repair Folder. 
- Checked for active Quick Filters (none are active).

- Verified Account Settings > Synchronization (set to "keep all messages local regardless of age").

- Tried toggling "Show only subscribed folders" in Advanced Server Settings.

Can someone please help?

Thank you
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:147.0.1;os:Windows 11
